content: प्रकृत {%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} {@--1@} Accomplished, completed. {@--2@} Commenced, begun. {@--3@} Appointed, charged. {@--4@} Genuine, real. {@--5@} Forming the subject of discussion, that which is under consideration, the subject in hand (often used in works on Alaṃkāra for उपमेय); संभावनमथोत्प्रेक्षा प्रकृतस्य समेन यत् <ls>K. P. 10.</ls> {@--6@} Important, interesting. {@--7@} Wished, expected. {@--8@} Original. --तं The original subject, the matter or subject in hand; यातु किमनेन प्रकृतमेव अनुसरामः ‘come to the point.’
